meanings.definition: A device on a camera that shows the field of view of the lens.
meanings.sent1: Photographers use viewfinders to frame their shots accurately.
meanings.sent2: The viewfinders on digital cameras help photographers compose their images.
meanings.sent3: I tried looking through the viewfinder with my eyes closed - not very effective!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a viewfinder, capturing every detail of the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The viewfinder acted like a magic window, revealing hidden beauty in the mundane.

meanings.definition: A person who views or looks at something.
meanings.sent1: The tourists were eager viewfinders, taking in the majestic landscape.
meanings.sent2: As a viewfinder, she appreciated the art in every painting she saw.
meanings.sent3: The viewfinder stared at the painting for so long, it felt like a staring contest.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like viewfinders, absorbing every detail of the scene before him.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was a curious viewfinder, exploring the world with wide eyes.
